trial_identification.studytitle: Efficacy of Silodosin in Expulsive Therapy of Lower Ureteral Stones: A Randomized Controlled trial
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Efficacy of silodosin in expulsive therapy of lower ureteral stones

interventions.interventions: silodosin (4 mg daily) orally for 2 weeks
interventions.comparator: lactose tablet orally daily for 2 weeks

primaryOutcome.timepoint: reported by patient within 2 weeks or Stone presence and characteristics were diagnosed through x-ray of kidney-ureter-bladder, abdominal ultrasonography, intravenous urography and nonenhenced CT 2 weeks later
Stone presence and characteristics were diagnosed through x-ray of kidney-ureter-bladder, abdominal ultrasonography, intravenous urography and nonenhenced CT 2 weeks later

secondaryOutcome.timepoint: (All patients were prescribed ketorolac 10 mg three time per day for analgesic use and allowed to use sublingual buprenorphine 0.2 mg on demand) recorded by patient diaries in2 weeks
recorded by patient diaries in 2 weeks

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: patients with radiopaque lower ureteral stones>5mm
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: urinary tract infections, high-grade hydronephrosis, diabetes, ulcers, or a history of hypersensitivity toa-1 blocker and pregnant women were excluded. Patients with a history of spontaneous stone expulsion, hypotension, or those found to have systolic blood pressure lower than 110 mmHg

sponsorship.primarysponsoraddress: 60058 No 565 2nd Ta-Ya Rd Chia-Yi city, Taiwan,ROC St. Martin De Porres Hospital

fundingsource.fundingaddress: 60058 No 565 2nd Ta-Ya Rd Chia-Yi city, Taiwan,ROC St. Martin De Porres Hospital

ethicsAndSummary.summary: perform a comparative study to evaluate the clinical role of silodosin in the medical expulsive therapy of symptomatic lower ureteral stones.
